course.subject: MECH
course.name: Energy Systems in a Sustainable World
course.description: Various fuels used by mankind, fossil and renewable sources; power generation technologies and the controversies; energy efficient technologies and the applications in buildings and consumable products; energy efficient manufacturing technologies; low energy infrastructure and impact to modern life style; myths behind sustainable energy systems and the debates; energy entrepreneurship, case studies and social impact.

reviews.author: Billy~~
reviews.title: Great Choice For Engineering Students
reviews.comment_content:
A course about different energy sources such as solar, hydro, wind, nuclear, petroleum etc.

Most of them are common sense where you should have learnt it before, but just elaborate more on it by providing facts that you might not notice before.

Calculations and units conversion are quite important in this course, thus make sure to beware of different units in your homework and exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
A silent teaching environment as CIUCCI will stop talking if students were talking while he is teaching, but I do think it is a basic respect to stop talking while professor is teaching.

Decent amount of video clips are included in the ppt, and professor are willing to answer your questions.

The only thing to do in lesson is stay quiet, professor won't force you to answer any of the questions, but he will question the TAs XD.

Depends on your interest, some topics might interest you and some may make you sleep.
reviews.comment_grading:
Everyone is having a high score in the hw, mid-term and exam, so try double check your work if you have time.

HW            Mean             My Score
1                 34/40              35/40
2                 35.8/40            40/40
3                 90.7/100          97/100
Gp project    23.5/25            25/25
Mid-term      27.7/30            29/30
final results are not given.
Overall A

You can see the mean are quite high for the mid-term, so small mistake can make big difference.

Mid-tem involves 1 LQ with small questions in it + 10 MC
Final involves 1 LQ(way longer than the mid-term) + 20 MC

Try not to make any mistake in part a of your LQ, as you will need to use the result of it :)

There will also be paired-share exercise(kind of a group discussion) in the lesson, where you could earn bonus mark if you take at least 8 of them, just write your ideas on the note card and submit it to the TAs during the lessons.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignment before mid-term
1 assignment after mid-term as well as a group project(of 4 ppl) which requires you to read the materials and construct 1 paper (2 pages) of report on your reading materials, you are required to choose one from the given list of around 45 reading materials, every group must have a different topic, thus first come first serve.

Assignment are given about two weeks before the due date, thus you should have a plenty of time to deal with it.

Quite relax overall, you can also skip the class as no attendance are taken.

reviews.author: Defacto
reviews.comment_content: The course is a fairly thorough contextualization of the book "Without the Hot Air". It covers the fundamental aspects of energy systems and energy usage in the world, and provides a hypothetical scenario in which current world energy usage is balanced with theoretical possible sustainable energy output. It delves into the current limitations of the world's energy model, and discusses possible solutions. The physics and mathematics involved in the course are all fairly basic, and are mostly just "back of the envelope" calculations.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is highly knowledgeable in the subject and is keen and enthusiastic. He takes time at the beginning of every class to summarize the key points of the previous lecture, as well as runs through a course outline, making it easy to understand the progress made. He is open to answering questions after class or during his office hours. He is very fond of Maserati as well, despite teaching a sustainable energy class xd.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was based on several instances of in-class peer work, a small group project, a mid-term and a final examination. As the exams are all open book, attaining a decent grade is not hard with a bit of effort.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload in this course was minimal. There were no assignments throughout the course, and only one group project that involved summarizing a journal into 2 pages. The mid-term and final examinations were also fairly consistent with the course content, and the questions asked were all familiar. Along with the open-book nature of the exams, preparing for them wasn't too much of a hassle.

reviews.author: Hot and Sexy
reviews.comment_content:
呢個course通常spring sem先有
個course title已經講左係個sustainable development
其實好多野都唔洗背
有多時中學通識都有討論講
唔洗背 只要明白個under lying principle 就ok
通常計數都係sub數落條式就ok
但有時要轉少少腦 唔係一sub入去就係答案

exam open book、notes、mobile、computer...但唔可以連wifi，佢會random咁check
reviews.comment_teaching:
講英文幾好聽
但有少少悶
通常會播片
每堂通常會有group discussion 然後寫落張佢比你既card度
好似夠8次加3％ marks..
唔太記得...
reviews.comment_grading:
MID TERM MEAN= 24/30
Mean 極高 基本上錯少少就已經係咁先

我mid term below bean少少
final冇講成績
hw 100％
project 21／25
最後c range

每堂通常會有group discussion 然後寫落張佢比你既card度
好似夠8次加3％ marks..
唔太記得...
reviews.comment_workload:
有3份好麻煩既功課
除左計數之外有時仲要睇readings、上網搵資料等等再用英文寫一大抽野
之後仲有group paper review project
即係一組人睇一份academic journal
然後打max 2pages 既review

reviews.author: Albert Liem
reviews.title: Relaxing and interesting course!
reviews.comment_content:
The content is based on "Without Hot Air" where you learn about your energy expenses such as Air and Land transportation, Heating and Cooling, Manufacturing, Food and Lighting and energy generation such as solar , wind , wave, tide , hydroelectric , geothermal , biomass etc.Anyways, i genuinely find them all very interesting and get a way better understanding of what is happening on the energy sector.

All the best to anyone taking this :)
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer and TA all extremely friendly and chill. Might be boring for some but try to answer his question when he asks the class as usually the class will remain quiet.I appreciate his kindness and dedication so I tried to answer them even though I am the only one in the class speaking. Though his SWEET THICK ITALIAN PASTA accent need some time to get used to, it's not a problem at all
reviews.comment_grading:
The paper is extremely manageable , don't worry about the midterm and finals.Just use logic, do the slides exercise and skim through the textbook is more than enough to get 100% for the paper.

Grade: A*
midterm mark: Full Mark
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is extremely light, every class there will be a five minute discussion where you write answer in pair and give about 3-4 logical points.There is no right or wrong and if you have done 8 (attend 8 classes) you get bonus 5% for your final grading, which is nice.

There are 3 assignment you have to do throughout the course so its light as well

reviews.author: Andrew1024
reviews.title: avoid taking this course if u make a lot of careless mistakes
reviews.comment_content:
same as previous comments mentioned.

The materials taught in this class are not difficult. Just some simple physics. Having taken DSE Physics would definitely be an advantage.

You may skip the lectures since attendence is not counted towards the final grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
• Homework 10%
• Project Report 20%
• Mid-Term Exam 30%
• Final Exam 40%

The grade sucks.

For the homework, it is okay. It doesn't focus much on the correctness of the final answer. However, make sure that you are using the right formula.

For the report, it is fine as long as you meet the requirement.

For both the midterm and final, since they are open-book, the competition here is really high. You need to be 100% sure that you are on the right track, so study TA's slides on exam preparation in advance. Making some mistakes already matters a lot.
BE EXTREMELY CAREFUL!!!

In addition, you have a chance to gain a 5% bonus if you conduct at least 1/3 (~8) of the pair-share exercises that will take place in class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just 3 assignments in total.

The project should be easy as it only requires a summarization of an article.

The only workload is to be familiar with the lecture materials.

reviews.author: hibadgrade
reviews.title: Not as good as others said
reviews.comment_content:
Refer to others comment.
Not much change
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely tedious and dull. He just read the powerpoint once at the lecture, very few explanation to the content. 1/3 of the lesson time was given to pair share where you will have time to discuss a short question with your friends or you can meet new friends at the lesson. No need to attend lecture if you got one friend attending for you and answer the pair share on his own.
reviews.comment_grading:
HW1/2/3 10%
Review Essay 20%
MT 30%
Final 40%

God Damn worst grade ever.
MT Mean 28/30 -> me 30
Final Mean 44/60 -> me 52(highest 56)
HW1/2/3 not released but check answer on chegg -> around 90%(must be above mean)
Review Essay unknown -> should not be too bad

Final grade A-
BAD AS FX
Dont know why this grade come out
expect higher
reviews.comment_workload:
Brush grade
No workload for high year std

reviews.author: Edward1141
reviews.comment_content: The course is talking about energy. It discusses different energy sources and most of the contents are common sense
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very good. Not only reading the ppt and there are lots of discussions which you can easily follow but it can also let you think more.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm and exam are pretty easy and both of them are open-book. Therefore, the mean is usually very high.
You only need to be careful and you can easily get in A range.
reviews.comment_workload: almost no workload, only 3 simple assignments in one semester.

reviews.author: nani
reviews.title: good grade common core
reviews.comment_content:
The course material is about all kinds of consumption and sustainable production, and see if production can offset the consumption by calculating the numbers.  
Many contents are similar to DSE Physics elective: Energy and use of energy, simple calculations only not that intensive

1. Climate change, global warming, greenhouse effect
2. Thermodynamics: different energy and power units, Laws of thermodynamics ( internal energy= Work done + Heat flow into the system )
3. Transportation energy expenses  e.g. calculate the consumption of airplane travel, simple maths just remember to convert the units
4. Onshore wind Energy
5. Offshore Wing energy
6. Solar energy (calculating surface area of solar panels and power )
7. Hydro nad wave energy
8. Food and farming
9. EROI and nuclear
10. Cars
11. EV
12. Batteries
13. Energy losses and ventilation in building ( UA delta T)
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very passionate. He hates people talking in his class and he will stop when somebody is speaking. He will try to remember your name if you answer questions.

The tutorial and assignment include everything, similar questions in the midterm and finals.

(Sometimes might be a bit sleepy
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm and final are in the same format.
MC questions involve some calculation and qualitative question (use common sense)

Open book and notes, you can use an electronic device to view your notes, just turn off wifi.
Everyone brings their iPad and computer to the exam :)

Mostly calculating the energy
Midterm: transportation power consumption, wind, solar, hydroelectric = mgh, HVAC
reviews.comment_workload:
3 homework, 1 midterm and 1 final, 1 summary group project.

The group project is simple, just summarise a reading article provided. Not much workload.

reviews.author: Telia
reviews.comment_content: The course content follows the textbook "Without the Hot Air" by David MacKay, Covering contents and calculations regarding energy expenses and renewable energy sources. Overall it can be quite fun for people who is interested in sustainability.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Francesco is passionate about this course, he tried to make the class more interactive and would give out open-ended questions occasionally. If you answer his questions he will remember you (in a good way), and he is also willing to answer your questions. But sometimes the lessons can be boring since you can simply read the PPT slides.
However, I think he won't teach this course anymore...
reviews.comment_grading:
HW: 10%
summary report: 20%
mid-term: 30%
final: 40%

I think the grading is reasonable, however the mean can be quite high for exams
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, only three homework, one summary report project, and some 'pair-share' exercise in class for bonus points. Homework are calculations and some open ended opinion based questions, the group report is choosing a thesis paper and compose a summary about it.

reviews.author: haha_fml
reviews.comment_content:
easy course about different energy sources

should be easy if you've had basic physics classes from hs
reviews.comment_teaching:
didnt go to class after the first 8 (extra 5%) but from what i've been through, he's pretty chill

most of the class he goes through the ppt, shows some videos on the slides (monotone reading)

could get quite boring cuz u can go thru those slides in abt 10 mins

stay quiet during class he would literally stop talking if u talk while he is
reviews.comment_grading:
quite fair i suppose

u need to get a high grade in all of the assignments and tests to get a good score ig

the grp project is quite simple so you dont need to worry abt it - if ur grpmates rnt incompetent itll be done in less than 2 hrs

the mid-term and final jst required logic - go through the tutorials that the TAs give at the end - it was open notes so going thru the slides once was fine

extra 5% if u do 1/3 of the pair-share exercises - its jst sharing your opinion no need to stress, they're free points
reviews.comment_workload:
little to none?
3 hw + 1 project the whole sem, if you cant get thru this i srsly hope for the best for u

reviews.author: subin0803
reviews.title: Easy contents
reviews.comment_content:
You will learn about physics-related content about energy consumptions and resources, etc. The lectures are quite easy and understandable.

1. Introduction to the course and Motivation 1
2. Motivation 2 & 1st law of Thermodynamics  
3. 2nd law of Thermodynamics & Transportation Expenses 1 (cars and airplanes)
4. Transportation Expenses 2 (light and gadgets) & Resources 1: Wind energy (Onshore)
5. Resources 1: Wind energy (Offshore), Resources 2: Solar energy (part 1)
6. Resources 2: Solar energy (part 2)
7. Hydro and Wave Energy, Tutorial
8. Round-Up, EROI, and Nuclear energy
9. Midterm review + Midterm exam
10. Geothermal & Expenses 1 (manufacturing), Expenses 2: Food/Farming/Public Services
11. Better Transportation, Energy storage systems (part 1)
12. Energy storage systems (part2), Energy Losses and Ventilation in Buildings
13. Air: Aerothermal and Wind Energy technology, Solar energy technology
reviews.comment_teaching: Many of the contents are common sense, and lecture slides are good. So, the professor kinda read through the lecture slides, but he's teaching was good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 10%  
Project report 20%
Mid-Term Exam 30%
Final Exam 40%
+ You have a chance to gain a 5% bonus if you conduct at least 1/3 (~8) of the pair share exercises
that will take place in class.

Grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Both midterm and final exams were open-book and quite easy.

reviews.author: Adrian Ng
reviews.title: Overall nice course
reviews.comment_content: Different aspects about sustainable energy, nothing surprising,  content is simple. If you pay attention in class and study the content carefully you will be able to get good grades.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is nice as it is not boring and does not read along with the ppt, he will answer all of the questions in detail.
reviews.comment_grading: Got high grades for mid-term and finals as well as homework. Above 90%
reviews.comment_workload: Very light as there are only three assignments through out the course and you need to participate in group discussion during class to get bonus points. As well as only on group project.

reviews.author: Noaa
reviews.title: Easy, but Not Quite.
reviews.comment_content:
The professor loves to describe this course as a way to "sustain a conversation about energy", which sums the content of this course pretty well.

The course can be divided into two major parts.

The first part consisted of current use of energy, its source and the repercussions of using non-renewable sources.

The second part consisted of currently available sources of renewable energy, its feasibility and the future of renewable energy technology.

Overall, the content of the course is rather simple and consists of information that would've been taught during primary and secondary education. But there are some facts and calculations that helps with the understanding of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ciucci and the TAs (Ms. Mei and Mr. Curcio)  were extremely calm, friendly and easygoing. I have to admit, I did end up falling asleep for some of the classes, but the professors and TA were extremely helpful and knowledgeable when I approached them after class for some questions.

It is just a shame that I weren't able to attend this class in real life.

In general, the quality of teaching is good and I was able to learn quite a lot from the professor and TA of this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Despite every other aspect of this course being rather easy-breezy, I would guess that grading well in this course will be a difficult task to achieve.

During my midterms, the mean score was 28.5/30. Shows that the vast majority of the class has recieved a full mark or one mistake at best.  

Finals was a bit more lax (but I can't remember the exact numbers), but it still was higher than any of the other courses I've taken this semester.

The mean score for the project was also very much close to the full mark.

The course may be simple, but you should definitely take it quite seriously if you are aiming to be a high achiever in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is extremely light.

There are in-class discussions, where you are grouped with random classmates and are asked to bring 4-6 logical points about a question. Each last about 5 minutes and none of the questions have a right or wrong answer. If you do 8 of these discussions, you get a bonus 5% for the final grading.

There were 3 homeworks, with some calculations and short answer questions. The calculations do not go over basic arithmatic levels, but does require some knowledge about unit conversions and efficiency. Most of the equations necessary to calculate the problems were provided in the homework paper as well.

There was one group project, where we had to summarize an 2-3 page article. Given good teamwork, it shouldn't be too difficult to deal with.

In general, the workload is very much possible to handle, even in conjunction with other heavy workload courses.

reviews.author: dddddddddd
reviews.comment_content:
I. Understand and analyze energy conversion, utilization and storage for renewable technologies
such as wind, solar, biomass, fuel cells and hybrid systems and for conventional fossil fuel-based
technologies;
II. Use the first and second law of thermodynamics and introductory thermodynamics to analyze
renewable energy systems;
III. Understand the environmental consequences of energy conversion and how renewable energy
can reduce air pollution and global climate change.
reviews.comment_teaching: He has a nice accent and funny jokes. Given the content is mediocre I cannot say much if he explains the content nicely.
reviews.comment_grading:
Each component will be evaluated as follows:
Homework 10%
Project report 20%
Mid-Term Exam 30%
Final Exam 40%
You have a chance to gain a 5% bonus if you conduct at least 1/3 (~8) of the pair share exercises
that will take place in class.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, just 3 assignments.

reviews.author: rind
reviews.title: Choose it if you want a good grade
reviews.comment_content:
The content is about different renewable energy. It uses a quantitative way to calculate the energy expenses of our daily lives and the possible energy generated by different renewable energy and some thermodynamics. It will be good if you study Physics before but since it is a common core course. The content actually is extremely easy because most of them are common sense.
Be sensitive to units.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor and TA are very nice. Usually professor won't ask you questions. Instead, he will ask the TA to answer his questions. No chat is permitted in the class. He will stop and wait until nobody talks if someone is talking. It will be fun to have his lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 assignments
1 midterm: very easy, many students score full mark
1 project
suppose to have a final, but it is cancelled
5% bonus will be rewarded if you attend the first 8 lessons and participate in the pair share exercise.
Grade has released:
I got a B+ in this course.
I haven't mark down my scores of homework but most of them are 95% up
midterm: full mark
project: doesn't release mark
5% bonus got
Probably since the content is too easy, many students are getting high marks. Maybe you have to be careful for everything. If you want to get A range then everything has to be perfect. Kind of stressful, but B range is still easy to achieve.
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely low workload.
Midterm is open-booked, don't have to spend much time on revising.
The project is very light, read an article and write a report within 2 pages.
The assignments are actually quite easy. Spending about 1-2 hours for each assignment.

reviews.author: Kero
reviews.title: BE READY TO FIGHT WITH MECH YEAR4 STUDENT
reviews.comment_content: it focus mostly in energy aspect with energy consumption and renewable energy stuff, all the things u learn from this course are quite common knowledge but still u will need to recite the details of the material and data.
reviews.comment_teaching: I have to say the lessons are not worth attaining as u can just look through the ppt at home within 15min but the prof take 1.5 hours to finish it.
reviews.comment_grading: Best grade I have ever get in my life but remind that most of the participants of the course are mech year 4 students, so if you are year 1 or coming from busi school, u should know most of your competitors are well-trained mech students.
reviews.comment_workload: An easy project which u can finish in 1-2 hr and with normal homework and also freaking attendance, however, as i skipped the first few lessons, I think I won't get the 5% marks as it needs you to attain almost all lessons to get that freaking little 5%

reviews.author: Your Highness
reviews.comment_content: It is basically a brief review of existing renewable energy resources. One may find quite interesting, but in another way, one may find the content quite monotonous. It might be quite easy for those having some physics background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mr. Ciucci has enthusiasm in what he is teaching and always open to students’ doubts. The TAs were also passionate in helping students. Feel free to ask questions.
reviews.comment_grading: I find it fair enough. All the exams were open-book - you can take your own laptop into the examination hall (with all network functions disabled). But watch out with minor mistakes in homeworks - those will eat up some marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Three individual homeworks and one group article review. They don’t require much work, but just some effort that won’t make you tired.

reviews.author: Michelleung
reviews.title: Easy Course for FM
reviews.comment_content: The content is mainly about renewable energy. Some simple calculation will be included. The main renewable energy mentioned are solar, wind, and hydroelectric. It is quite easy to understand and interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor explains clearly in each topic. The materials prepared by the TAs are interesting and informative. The professor often provides videos and study materials like articles for the student to learn outside the lecture. He is also willing to answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is based on the homework handed in, the peer share exercise in lecture, the group article summary and the exams.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is quite low. 3 homework with simple calculations involved and short essay. There is a group project summarizing the selected article. Finally, there is a mid-term and final exam. It is quite easy to finish the above workload.

reviews.author: 茄子
reviews.comment_content:
On energy consumption and production. The course syllabus is completely based on a book called 'Sustainable Energy — without the hot air', which can be downloaded from an online site(given by the professor) for free. You are recommended to read it, but it is also okay if you don't.

Includes basic calculations like P=mgh, etc.
The calculation will become harder after the mid-term, but it is still easy since the formula is given to you and the exams are open book. Note the units of the calculations though.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Starts almost every lesson with the goal of the course.
Quite knowledgable in his area, is funny sometimes. He hates people talking in class though (when it is not discussion time yet), which I think is reasonable because it is basic respect.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due the simplicity of the course material, the mid-terms and the homework (3 pieces), the mean is extremely high. You need to perhaps get full mark in a few of them to get above A-. The final exam is a lot harder this year, it could be because of the student review done in the middle of the semester, where one student said that the mid-term and the homework are too easy.

*Mean or SD are not calculated for you, if you want to, you probably can calculate it on your own as the marks of all students are posted)
*All are open book, including exams. You can bring your laptop (wifi function needs to be turned off) and your own notes.
Homework:
1. 33/40
2. 40/40
3. 96/100
Project: don't know mean and mark
Midterm: 30/30
Final: Don't know
Final Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Mid-term exam (30%)
3 Homework (10%)
1 Final exam (40%)
1 Project (20%) (in groups of 4, need to do a 1 page summary for a scientific article -> very easy)
Attendance: extra marks (he requires you to write down your student ID on a card along with what you have discussed with your fellow classmates after discussion time. There is a discussion question in almost every lesson)

reviews.author: 皮斯卡
reviews.title: 靚grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Talk about sustainable energy.
Wind energy, solar power, zinc battery, hydroelectric stations, power consumed by different transportation.
The content is easy, as it is a common core, exam is open-book and all the equations can be found in the power point.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor explain clearly but very slowly. He talk about the power point for 80 minutes but you can finish it in 15 minutes if u read it at home. The lesson is quite boring. I only attend 5 to 6 lessons then skipped all of the rest.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good. If u hv learnt physics before, the content will be easy for u and the only thing you have to do is to substitute the numbers into the equations provided. The difficulty is focus on the change of units of energy. Do 8 times pair-sharing exercise can have 5% bonus mark.
HW1 34/40
HW2 36/40
HW3 94/100
Midterm full mark
The score of project and final will not be shown.
Mid-term is super easy but a lot of calculations in final exam.
10分essay 寫幾個4-5個細point就得, 一個point一句, 唔洗浪費時間解釋同吹水
Final grade : A
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework and project is the only workload. Homework is not difficult but time-consuming. For the project, only summary of academic paper is required. 2 pages, no need to add personal opinions. I do the project alone, finish in one day.

A few revision is required because at least u have to know what equations are include in each power point. Then you can save a lot of time when doing examinations.

reviews.author: bagcal
reviews.title: It's ok
reviews.comment_content: The course follows the book "Hot air without air" which is also the textbook of phys1003. The material can be divided into 3 sections: consumption, production, and storage. In consumption, main energy expenses are roughly calculated. In production, energy from renewables is calculated to see relying solely on renewables is viable or not and renewable energy sources are introduced. In storage, various storage technologies are explained. Although the content is easy to follow, unfortunately, the way it is presented is sometimes boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Ciucci is one of the better professors, he is enthusiastic about the content and very knowledgeable. He shows some Youtube videos and adds peer sharing exercises to avoid a mundane classroom environment.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is based on peer sharing exercises, homework, article review, midterm and final. Even though the midterm was a walk in the park the final was sort of a killer compared to the midterm. Yet with the correct work discipline getting a high grade should not be a problem.
reviews.comment_workload:
The course almost has no work at all, the only aspect which required some work was the article review project which should be done in a group of 4. It shouldn't be a big deal if you have no free-riders in the group.
Also, there are 3 homework sets to be solved.

reviews.author: s.fcat.ac
reviews.title: Easy, enjoyable course. Good professor.
reviews.comment_content:
Content is fairly easy. By pretty much simple calculations on energy expenses of our daily life, and optimised calculations on production of renewable energies, the course have reached its aim on discovering sustainability and also on teaching about energy expenses that we have in our daily life.

Although the content is fairly easy, and the course is not challenging at all, this course successfully expanded my views on the sustainability of the world in terms of energy, and made myself more aware of our everyday expenses.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is great, very clear teaching and quite in-depth with a lot of supporting examples. Although a lot of stuff are learnt for me already I still attend his classes.

Just one thing to note is that he doesn't like people chatting in his lessons (except for pair-share exercises). He would stop speaking if he heard people talking in between.

If there is anything else that I have to note about... Hmmm I quite like this professor 😂😂😂 (wait what
reviews.comment_grading:
Content is fairly easy, so it is easy to obtain a high mark.
Grading consists of four parts: Homework 10%, Project report 20%, Mid-Term Exam 30%, Final Exam 40%.
In-class pair-share exercises may contribute to a 5% bonus to the grade (hand-in at least 3 of them!)

Didn't hand in one of the homework (yes I am lazy)
Didn't think I did a great job in the project report.
Midterm: mean around 27, +1SD is ard 31(over max score attainable) and I got 29/30.
Final: score unknown

Got an A still ;) Thanks
reviews.comment_workload:
Three assignments, a project report (article review), midterm and final.

Assignments are not hard, could be done within an hour.

Project report - recommended to start it early, so that you have more chances to ask the professor for opinions and help. The project report is an article review that mainly is about rounding up an article on the production of sustainable energy. The length of the article review may be no longer than two pages, so a lot of work is payed on whether to put some parts or not. Quite a lot of teamwork needed for that, or else such may lead to unwanted arguments.

Midterm is fairly easy, a basic calculation problem, a long question and then some MCQs.

Final is harder since the calculation is much longer, but still managed to do so since it is an open-book(actually laptop) exam. Format is almost the same as the midterm.

reviews.author: rickychan
reviews.comment_content: this course mainly introduces the sustainable technologies nowadays such as photovoltaics, thermal pumps, etc. most of them are easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
CIUCCI's accent is very cute and he looks hot BTW. Though the pace is quite slow for he reviews previous lectures every now and then, he explains everything clearly. he is also very nice.
I love CIUCCI!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade God!!!!!!!!
Midterms are quite simple, just basic calculations.
the final is a bit harder coz there are long questions, but it is open laptop, so things were fine for me
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is relatively satisfying because it is 1000-level course after all. Especially the project, it was just a summary for a paper, which could be done within several hours.

reviews.author: Ruby
reviews.title: Nice Course
reviews.comment_content:
This course is not difficult . Like secondary school level
I. Understand and analyze energy conversion, utilization and storage for renewable technologies
such as wind, solar, biomass, fuel cells and hybrid systems and for conventional fossil fuel-based
technologies;
II. Use the first and second law of thermodynamics and introductory thermodynamics to analyze
renewable energy systems;
III. Understand the environmental consequences of energy conversion and how renewable energy
can reduce air pollution and global climate change.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a visiting professor. He likes asking questions in class and getting response from the class. Every class is well-prepared and inspirational.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is great if you attend most of the class. The exam is quite easy since it is a 1XXX course so the mean is relatively high.
reviews.comment_workload: a total of 4 pieces of quizes and two group assignment and midterm and final which is finished in Canvas

reviews.author: gary_ho122
reviews.comment_content: A very interesting course. Talking about the energy problem and environmental issue about the worldwide and hong kong.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite interesting. Instructors will provide a youtube video in each lecture. The powerpoint and the materials are well prepare and upload to canvas.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very good.The final and midterm are allowed student to take the notes and computer during have the exam. It is very nice because we don't need to remember all the questions.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload, only one have 4 people in a group and write a 200 word essay.

reviews.author: Pasindu
reviews.comment_content:
Content is quite heavy as he will teach a large amount of sustainability techniques and also energy expenses.
He will start with simple concepts of thermodynamics and then go onto apply these to our daily energy expenses. The course content is very helpful in your daily life. The content to study for the mid term is rather heavy compared to the final but the mid term is far easier than the final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is amazing, and he revises work everyday by using a summary. He is a very friendly professor and quite a cool person too.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading can be tough. As the exams are not very hard, the competition increases. I expected an A+ but got an A. Also the homework and your group review project affects your grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is alright. Constant revision is needed to do well in the course as the work increases with time.

reviews.author: sandsou
reviews.comment_content:
有大概一半內容同DSE Physics Energy elective有關, 不過再廣泛深入啲啲

本身對能源環保有興趣先好讀, 如果唔係會悶親

計數基本上簡單, sub下數就得, 係要小心啲好多伏位同要轉單位

另外會有開放式問題, 例如講下太陽能正反之類; 不過exam open book/notebook/phone, 所以問題唔大, 用下腦諗下就得
reviews.comment_teaching:
英文講得唔錯, 不過有時會悶悶哋, 好間唔時會搞下gag; 但係prof有準備好多片, 有啲都幾得意嘅, 所以整體都唔錯

兩個tutor都ok嘅, 有心答同學問題
reviews.comment_grading:
• Homework (3份) 15%
• Project report 15%
• Mid-Term Exam 30%
• Final Exam 40%
• Bonus Points: 上堂會有pair-share exercises (無對錯, 同隔離位對問題諗幾個point), 做(交)夠8份final grade會加5%

(不過為趕進度今個sem得頭<10堂有得做pair-share, 所以如果想攞嗰5%嘅一開始最好上夠8堂做足)

啲分唔係好記得, 總之樣樣都近滿分(Final無成績睇), 最後A

因為考嘅嘢相對簡單, 所以無論homework考試都係鬥小心為多
reviews.comment_workload:
3份功課, 唔難, 不過要小心同用幾多時間下

Paper Review Project, 我哋組揀倒篇paper得幾頁, 份report又只可以最多2張紙長, 所以我呢個case係輕鬆嘅

考試open book, 之前係咁意睇下啲ppt就得, 唔使點記嘢, 鍾意可以自己整份cheat ntoes方便睇

reviews.author: 天狼星
reviews.title: 其實有D似DSE通識入面既能源科技與環境,所以都易上手
reviews.comment_content:
其實70%係能源科技與環境,30%係深入D既公式,同埋唔同能源科技既解釋,基本上COMMON SENSE就會明白既野黎,不過要留意既係冇理科底既朋友可能會有D吃力,建議留意下佢上堂播既片,同埋問下TA,佢地都好好人,唔洗擔心佢地會唔理你

至於內容,個內容好廣泛,由燒油去到唔同既環保能源都有,去到後面都幾多野要背,雖然可以CTRL+F,但係背左就有著數好多.
reviews.comment_teaching: 個呀SIR冇得頂,雖然有少少口音,不過好過好多其他PROF架啦,又好人.又好笑,同好認真,平時上堂都有片睇,不過上堂基本條件要守好,唔好講野,唔好玩手機,你尊重佢佢尊重你,呢D基本野一定要做好.咁佢都會樂意教多D野比大家.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade都幾靚既,分都好易拎,基本上就係MEAN 就有B- or B,但係要留意既係,功課,project,midterm final既mean都好高,一失手冇左1-2分就可能已經半個sd,我果陣個mean大約3分到,滿分30 in mid-term.所以要好好利用佢批准你用既野黎拎分.
reviews.comment_workload: WORKLOAD既其實都大,功課 考試 PROJECT 上堂問答都齊曬,功課就好似2-3星期一份,考試就唔洗講啦,一半之後就全部,都係出返功課野同有D CONCEPT問題,PROJECT 要睇下有幾多頁要總結,百幾頁果D就真係恭喜曬,你既WORKLOAD一定大到_ _,咁少既都有十幾頁,4個人分黎做都仲HANDLE到既,上堂問答都係OPEN ENDED,你有交紙仔就基本上有分,咁當然你比佢點到名既當然印象又好D啦

reviews.author: anis
reviews.title: Really enjoyed it !
reviews.comment_content: Interesting and always updated (The professor would sometimes talk about something that happened the previous week). Most of the content is a "general culture type" of information, thus not necessary to revise for the exam. However, important points should be kept in mind.
reviews.comment_teaching: One word : Excellent. He would repeat the important concepts many times, he would remind about the motivation of the course (Why are we here?) every single lecture and he would talk passionately, always linking it with the reality. Not easy to get bored I would say, unless you're not interested.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. Exams are sometimes unpredictable.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is okay ... Homeworks need time and the project (paper review) is a very good experience for those who want to do research.

reviews.author: swdk
reviews.title: Really enjoy the course
reviews.comment_content: The course covers different forms of sustainable energy resource as well as daily expenses of energy.The professor also convince us the importance of batteries to balance the supply and demand side. He is very nice and likes to make jokes about his dream car and sometimes challenging the TAs, I really enjoy his teaching. All the lectures materials are online.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Professors gives figures and calculations to convince us about his view towards different source of energy forms. For example his convinces us that lighting is only a really really small fraction of our daily energy expense. He also gives us data to convince us that wind and solar Photovoltaics energy has clearly more potential than other source of renewable energies.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grade. Easy A-range.
If you attend lesson and do the pair-share exercises (8 in total) you will receive extra marks.The midterm and final exams are both open books and open computers.(no access to the internet).
The exam is mainly focus on basic calculations and one follow up question about the topic. The Mcs are all very easy but the units might be bit tricky is you are not familiar with them.
reviews.comment_workload: There are in total 3 homeworks and one group project (a summary of an essay) The homework are quite easy and lots of people are getting full marks. As the exam is open book you dont need to spend much time in studying as the course materials are easy and all the calculations are simple so I think the workload as a whole is not that demanding.

reviews.author: donald
reviews.comment_content:
基本上都係講下energy 既野
professor 講故仔
上堂有小小discussion 咁
reviews.comment_teaching:
professor 講野幾有趣
上堂唔太悶
reviews.comment_grading:
好好grade
midterm/final 都係上網做
基本上你可以open note 咁做
上堂唔洗上　睇番notes都夠
reviews.comment_workload:
workload係十分十分小
midterm 係睇完文　跟住做下summary咁
final 全mc 超級易
有４－５個quizzes 都係mc同埋上網好

reviews.author: Lady Ann
reviews.title: Interesting course but DO NOT RISK IT
reviews.comment_content:
The content is relevant to the stated topic. However, it is far too easy to be considered a university-level course. I did learn a lot but most of the calculations were easier than my high school physics content, I wish the course could have extended the content further and dived deeper into each topic, but it is interesting regardless.

1)introduction
2)Motivation and the first law of thermodynamics
3)Second law of thermodynamics
4)Transportation expences
5)Wind energy
6)Solar energy
7)Hydro and wave energy
8)EROI and nuclear energy
9)Geothermal energy
10)Energy storage systems and better transport systems
11)Energy losses and ventilation
12)Aerothermal, wind energy and solar energy technology
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very nice and knowledgeable. The main issue was the combination of easy course materials, monotone lessons and slow learning pace made the classes extremely dull and boring at times. By the end of the course, attendance was down by over 60%. I think everyone who took the course this semester would agree that it would have been much better if it was done in person. Nevertheless learning from professor Francesco was a privilege.

He's quick to reply to your questions and interactive so the quality of teaching is definitely not bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading in this course is what makes this course rather horrifying. I averaged around 62.3/65 before the final which was equivalent to the mean. Thankfully the final exam was able to decrease the mean. Definitely wouldn't have felt good getting a B after scoring nearly 100%. I'm pretty sure people would be scoring this section on USTspace depending on their final grade as that was basically the entire grade.

homework - 15%
project report - 15%
mid term exam - 30%
final exam - 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very small and since half of the content is very basic knowledge and a majority of the remainder is what you learn during high school, you really don't have to spend too much time studying.

The homework assignments and project summary are the only additional work you have to do. But spending 6-8 hours on these is more than sufficient.

I wish they would add more homework or projects because this course is like a book you read before bedtime.

reviews.author: ruth
reviews.comment_content: A bit boring but very easy to understand. Only have small amount of simple calculation and don't require memorizing material. Just some common sense and sustainability topic discussed in HKDSE LS. Haven't studied in high school physics should be also able to get good grades.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not too bad. Professor always try to make funny jokes but I don't found them to be very funny. Just read from the powerpoint and play youtube video. Can skip lectures if you don't want the bonus marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy to get good grades if you had submitted all the homework and attend the exams. Mid term is open book. Usually got full marks in homework and mid term exam if you have checked your answers carefully before handing it.

Assignment
Mid-term exam
Final exam (No final exam in this term)
Group Project
Gain 5% bonus if you have participate in lectures and finished pair share exercise
reviews.comment_workload: Quite easy to handle. Only have 3 assignments and can be finished within 1 hour. The group project is quite easy, just a 2 page summary of reading materials.

reviews.author: Gman
reviews.comment_content: The content for this course was pretty heavy as the professor will go through sustainability techniques in detail along with the energy expenses that follow. Since this is an introductory course, he’ll start off with some basic concepts about thermodynamics, where we would go on to use them in calculating a rough estimate of our daily energy expenses. The content is definitely very useful for your daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is probably one of the best professors I’ve had so far. He comes prepared each lecture and recaps what we learnt in the previous lecture and makes absorbing all the information easier. He’s quite open to questions but preferably after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading really depends on how much effort you’ve put into your work. Since the exams are not that difficult, you can expect the mean to be quite high.

There will be homework and a group review project as well where the group review project tends to affect your grade a bit.
reviews.comment_workload: We got a total of 4 pieces of homework and one group project review, so I would say it’s pretty average. It’s always best to work on the group project as soon as possible as you’ll need to make sure all of you can work together well enough and complete it on time. Apart from that, constant revision is suggested if you wish to keep up and do well in the course.

reviews.author: sgargaa
reviews.title: Never judge a course by the add/drop period
reviews.comment_content: The course seemed pretty decent and interesting during the add/drop period. But as soon as the add/drop period ended, the speed of the course picked up and it showed its true colours. There is a lot of new material, mainly about sustainability. It covers all the different forms of producing energy, like solar, wind, thermal etc. There are a lot of numericals in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches well, but he seemed a bit arrogant as he stops the class briefly for a few seconds if he sees any two random people talking in class until and unless he has the full attention of everybody. Other than that, by the way the professor teaches, we can make out that he loves what he teaches.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 30%
Mid-Term Exam: 20%
Final Exam: 30%
Project report: 20%
You get a bonus of 5% if you attend more than 1/3rd of the classes, which is usually around 7-8 classes in the semester.
reviews.comment_workload: There is a high workload, as in there is a lot of information to understand and digest. There is a lot of cramming work.

reviews.author: GK
reviews.title: Weird summer semester
reviews.comment_content: Mainly about sustainability. You can tell what it is. Not even new technology are being mentioned. No calculation at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is a visiting professor from America. He is a pro-environmental friendly professor. He is trying his best to make us be environmentally friendly. He talked many many things about that topic, making himself not able to finish the syllabus in the end of the semester. The teaching method is special and more on interaction
reviews.comment_grading: The grading system were changed so many times. I don't really know how the grade is calculated. But it shall have included online quiz, midterm, final exam and two assignment. I got over 100% in the end of course but still only got an A, not A+. Very very bad grade in terms of such an easy course
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low because all the quiz, assignment and exam is online. It means all the things are open laptop and even open network. The content is so liberal study that no new things are being learnt for me.  The workload is super low.
